channel.title: Homes on Nitish Srivastava
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Nitish Srivastava

item.description: Biography I am a 5th year PhD candidate in Computer System Laboratory (CSL) at Cornell University. My research interests are computer architecture, high level synthesis and very large scale integration. I am being advised by Prof. David Albonesi and Prof. Zhiru Zhang. You can find my CV.

item.title: Talks
item.description: T2S-Tensor: Productively Generating High-Performance Spatial Hardware for Dense Tensor Computations We present a language and compilation framework for productively generating high-performance systolic arrays for dense tensor kernels on spatial architectures, including FPGAs and CGRAs. It decouples a functional specification from a spatial mapping, allowing programmers to quickly explore various spatial optimizations for the same function. The actual implementation of these optimizations is left to a compiler. Thus, productivity and performance are achieved at the same time.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: I have been TA for following courses at Cornell University: CS3420: Embedded Systems
